MemoryConfigs.Name: Enable TCP/IP Access
MemoryConfigs.Description: Without this feature, you will always receive a 'Failed to Join' error when hosting a TCP/IP game

MemoryConfigs.Name: Allow Character Levels 100+
MemoryConfigs.Description: Without this feature, you will always receive a 'Failed to Join' error when entering a game with a level 100+ character

MemoryConfigs.Name: Display Player Names When Trading
MemoryConfigs.Description: Without this feature, player names will not show in the trade window

MemoryConfigs.Name: Customize Max Stash Gold
MemoryConfigs.Description: Allows you to control the maximum gold able to be stored in your stash

MemoryConfigs.Name: Customize Max Character Gold
MemoryConfigs.Description: Allows you to control the maximum gold able to be stored on your player (Character Level x Value)

MemoryConfigs.Name: Customize Save File Limit
MemoryConfigs.Description: Allows you to control the maximum save file size. We are replacing the first half of the byte stack only

MemoryConfigs.Name: Player Difficulty Scaling Override (Max/UI)
MemoryConfigs.Description: Allows you to control the maximum player difficulty. These addresses are for UI and client checks

MemoryConfigs.Name: Player Difficulty Scaling Override (Command)
MemoryConfigs.Description: Allows you to control the maximum player difficulty. This address is for the player command

MemoryConfigs.Name: Player Difficulty Scaling Override (Actual)
MemoryConfigs.Description: Allows you to control the maximum player difficulty. This address is for the server value

MemoryConfigs.Name: Force Classic Whirlwind
MemoryConfigs.Description: Changes the WW BP calcs to use 1FPA attacks instead of 4FPA for max speed

MemoryConfigs.Name: Increase Max Item Level (Drop)
MemoryConfigs.Description: Changes the maximum item level that is allowed to drop. This address controls the check value

MemoryConfigs.Name: Increase Max Item Level (Drop)
MemoryConfigs.Description: Changes the maximum item level that is allowed to drop. This address controls the forced value

MemoryConfigs.Name: Expose Item Level to Clients
MemoryConfigs.Description: Allows for non-hosts in TCP/IP games to see the ilvls of items via the loot filter

MemoryConfigs.Name: Hit Chance % (Lower Bound)
MemoryConfigs.Description: Changes the lower bound for hit% rates (monster and player)

MemoryConfigs.Name: Hit Chance % (Upper Bound)
MemoryConfigs.Description: Changes the lower bound for hit% rates (monster and player)

MemoryConfigs.Name: Hit Chance % (Display Fix)
MemoryConfigs.Description: This will allow 0% value to be shown on character stats screen if lower bound edits are used

MemoryConfigs.Name: Disable Run Penalty for Defense
MemoryConfigs.Description: This will disable run penalties. The animation mode used for the check is invalid

MemoryConfigs.Name: Sundered MonUMods Patch
MemoryConfigs.Description: This will change the monumod application condition from >=100 to >=99. Recommended if using our customized Sunder mechanic

MemoryConfigs.Name: Allow CTC while Uninterruptible (On Target)
MemoryConfigs.Description: This will remove the check for the Uninterruptible state on the SkillOnTarget function

MemoryConfigs.Name: Allow CTC while Uninterruptible (On Position)
MemoryConfigs.Description: This will remove the check for the Uninterruptible state on the SkillOnPosition function
